ChatGPT said:

Below is the implementation for your Manage Product Requests page. It follows the structure you described and includes mock data for demonstration:

Code: page.tsx

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      status: 'Pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      status: 'Completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      status: 'Pending',
    },
  ]);

  const completeRequest = (id: number) => {
    setRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) =>
        request.id === id ? { ...request, status: 'Completed' } : request
      )
    );
  };

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      {/* Title */}
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      {/* Tabs */}
      <div className="tabs">
        <button className="tab">Pre-orders</button>
        <button className="tab">Order Requests</button>
      </div>

      {/* Table */}
      <table className="requests-table">
        <thead>
          <tr>
            <th>User Email</th>
            <th>User Name</th>
            <th>Item Name</th>
            <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
            <th>Status</th>
            <th>Action</th>
          </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
          {requests.map((request) => (
            <tr key={request.id}>
              <td>{request.email}</td>
              <td>{request.name}</td>
              <td>{request.item}</td>
              <td>{request.quantity}</td>
              <td>
                <span
                  className={`status-label ${
                    request.status === 'Completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                  }`}
                >
                  {request.status}
                </span>
              </td>
              <td>
                {request.status === 'Pending' && (
                  <button
                    className="complete-button"
                    onClick={() => completeRequest(request.id)}
                  >
                    Complete
                  </button>
                )}
              </td>
            </tr>
          ))}
        </tbody>
      </table>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

Key Features:

  1. Tabs: Simple buttons styled as tabs with an underline.
  2. Table Headers: User email, user name, item name, quantity, status, and action.
  3. Status Labels: Color-coded labels for "Completed" (green) and "Pending" (grey).
  4. Complete Button: Changes status to "Completed" for pending requests.
  5. Mock Data: Replaceable with backend integration later.

ChatGPT said:

Here’s how you can add a search button to allow searching by user name and item name.

I’ve added a search input field and button above the table, allowing the admin to search for requests based on the user name or item name. The logic has been updated so that the table filters based on the search input.

Updated Code: page.tsx

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      status: 'Pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      status: 'Completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      status: 'Pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');

  const completeRequest = (id: number) => {
    setRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) =>
        request.id === id ? { ...request, status: 'Completed' } : request
      )
    );
  };

  const filteredRequests = requests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      {/* Title */}
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      {/* Search Filter */}
      <div className="search-container">
        <input
          type="text"
          placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
          value={searchTerm}
          onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
          className="search-input"
        />
        <button className="search-button" onClick={() => setSearchTerm(searchTerm)}>
          Search
        </button>
      </div>

      {/* Tabs */}
      <div className="tabs">
        <button className="tab">Pre-orders</button>
        <button className="tab">Order Requests</button>
      </div>

      {/* Table */}
      <table className="requests-table">
        <thead>
          <tr>
            <th>User Email</th>
            <th>User Name</th>
            <th>Item Name</th>
            <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
            <th>Status</th>
            <th>Action</th>
          </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
          {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
            <tr key={request.id}>
              <td>{request.email}</td>
              <td>{request.name}</td>
              <td>{request.item}</td>
              <td>{request.quantity}</td>
              <td>
                <span
                  className={`status-label ${
                    request.status === 'Completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                  }`}
                >
                  {request.status}
                </span>
              </td>
              <td>
                {request.status === 'Pending' && (
                  <button
                    className="complete-button"
                    onClick={() => completeRequest(request.id)}
                  >
                    Complete
                  </button>
                )}
              </td>
            </tr>
          ))}
        </tbody>
      </table>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

Updated JSX and CSS:

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      status: 'Pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      status: 'Completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      status: 'Pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');

  const completeRequest = (id: number) => {
    setRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) =>
        request.id === id ? { ...request, status: 'Completed' } : request
      )
    );
  };

  const filteredRequests = requests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      {/* Title */}
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      {/* Search and Tabs Container */}
      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        {/* Tabs */}
        <div className="tabs">
          <button className="tab">Pre-orders</button>
          <button className="tab">Order Requests</button>
        </div>

        {/* Search Filter */}
        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Table */}
      <table className="requests-table">
        <thead>
          <tr>
            <th>User Email</th>
            <th>User Name</th>
            <th>Item Name</th>
            <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
            <th>Status</th>
            <th>Action</th>
          </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
          {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
            <tr key={request.id}>
              <td>{request.email}</td>
              <td>{request.name}</td>
              <td>{request.item}</td>
              <td>{request.quantity}</td>
              <td>
                <span
                  className={`status-label ${
                    request.status === 'Completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                  }`}
                >
                  {request.status}
                </span>
              </td>
              <td>
                {request.status === 'Pending' && (
                  <button
                    className="complete-button"
                    onClick={() => completeRequest(request.id)}
                  >
                    Complete
                  </button>
                )}
              </td>
            </tr>
          ))}
        </tbody>
      </table>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

Updated ProductRequestsPage:

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      status: 'Pending',
      date: '2025-01-15',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/notebook.jpg',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      status: 'Completed',
      date: '2025-01-14',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/pencil.jpg',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      status: 'Pending',
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');

  const completeRequest = (id: number) => {
    setRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) =>
        request.id === id ? { ...request, status: 'Completed' } : request
      )
    );
  };

  const filteredRequests = requests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      {/* Title */}
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      {/* Search and Tabs Container */}
      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        {/* Tabs */}
        <div className="tabs">
          <button className="tab">Pre-orders</button>
          <button className="tab">Order Requests</button>
        </div>

        {/* Search Filter */}
        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Table */}
      <table className="requests-table">
        <thead>
          <tr>
            <th>Date</th>
            <th>User Email</th>
            <th>User Name</th>
            <th>Item Name</th>
            <th>Item Image</th>
            <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
            <th>Status</th>
            <th>Action</th>
          </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
          {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
            <tr key={request.id}>
              <td>{request.date}</td>
              <td>{request.email}</td>
              <td>{request.name}</td>
              <td>{request.item}</td>
              <td>
                <img
                  src={request.imageUrl}
                  alt={request.item}
                  style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                />
              </td>
              <td>{request.quantity}</td>
              <td>
                <span
                  className={`status-label ${
                    request.status === 'Completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                  }`}
                >
                  {request.status}
                </span>
              </td>
              <td>
                {request.status === 'Pending' && (
                  <button
                    className="complete-button"
                    onClick={() => completeRequest(request.id)}
                  >
                    Complete
                  </button>
                )}
              </td>
            </tr>
          ))}
        </tbody>
      </table>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

ChatGPT said:

To update your Product Requests Page and ensure the Pre-orders table behaves according to your requirements, here's how the changes will be implemented:

Product Requests Page (Updated)

  1. Remove the "Status" column and replace it with "Current Inventory."
  2. Modify Action Column to show either a Back in stock (green) or Unavailable (red) button.
  3. If either button is pressed, the corresponding row will be deleted from the table.

ProductRequestsPage.tsx

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      date: '2025-01-15',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/notebook.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50, // New field to show current inventory
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      date: '2025-01-14',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/pencil.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
      currentInventory: 20,
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');

  const handleActionClick = (id: number, action: string) => {
    setRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.filter((request) => request.id !== id)
    );
  };

  const filteredRequests = requests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      {/* Title */}
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      {/* Search and Tabs Container */}
      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        {/* Tabs */}
        <div className="tabs">
          <button className="tab">Pre-orders</button>
          <button className="tab">Order Requests</button>
        </div>

        {/* Search Filter */}
        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Table */}
      <table className="requests-table">
        <thead>
          <tr>
            <th>Date</th>
            <th>User Email</th>
            <th>User Name</th>
            <th>Item Name</th>
            <th>Item Image</th>
            <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
            <th>Current Inventory</th> {/* New column */}
            <th>Action</th>
          </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
          {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
            <tr key={request.id}>
              <td>{request.date}</td>
              <td>{request.email}</td>
              <td>{request.name}</td>
              <td>{request.item}</td>
              <td>
                <img
                  src={request.imageUrl}
                  alt={request.item}
                  style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                />
              </td>
              <td>{request.quantity}</td>
              <td>{request.currentInventory}</td> {/* Show current inventory */}
              <td>
                <button
                  className="action-button"
                  style={{
                    backgroundColor: 'green',
                    color: 'white',
                  }}
                  onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'backInStock')}
                >
                  Back in stock
                </button>
                <button
                  className="action-button"
                  style={{
                    backgroundColor: 'red',
                    color: 'white',
                  }}
                  onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'unavailable')}
                >
                  Unavailable
                </button>
              </td>
            </tr>
          ))}
        </tbody>
      </table>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

css

To apply the new styles to your ProductRequestsPage React component, you can update the inline styles for the action buttons and ensure that the CSS classes for the lighter green and red colors are used. Here's the modified code:

Updated Code for ProductRequestsPage Component:

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      date: '2025-01-15',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/notebook.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50, // New field to show current inventory
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      date: '2025-01-14',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/pencil.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
      currentInventory: 20,
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');

  const handleActionClick = (id: number, action: string) => {
    setRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.filter((request) => request.id !== id)
    );
  };

  const filteredRequests = requests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      {/* Title */}
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      {/* Search and Tabs Container */}
      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        {/* Tabs */}
        <div className="tabs">
          <button className="tab">Pre-orders</button>
          <button className="tab">Order Requests</button>
        </div>

        {/* Search Filter */}
        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Table */}
      <table className="requests-table">
        <thead>
          <tr>
            <th>Date</th>
            <th>User Email</th>
            <th>User Name</th>
            <th>Item Name</th>
            <th>Item Image</th>
            <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
            <th>Current Inventory</th> {/* New column */}
            <th>Action</th>
          </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
          {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
            <tr key={request.id}>
              <td>{request.date}</td>
              <td>{request.email}</td>
              <td>{request.name}</td>
              <td>{request.item}</td>
              <td>
                <img
                  src={request.imageUrl}
                  alt={request.item}
                  style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                />
              </td>
              <td>{request.quantity}</td>
              <td>{request.currentInventory}</td> {/* Show current inventory */}
              <td>
                <button
                  className="action-button green"
                  onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'backInStock')}
                >
                  Back in stock
                </button>
                <button
                  className="action-button red"
                  onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'unavailable')}
                >
                  Unavailable
                </button>
              </td>
            </tr>
          ))}
        </tbody>
      </table>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

Key Updates:

  1. Action Buttons with Classes:

    • Changed the inline styles for the "Back in Stock" button and "Unavailable" button to use the green and red classes from your updated CSS instead of inline styles.
    • This ensures the action buttons reflect the lighter green and red shades and their respective spacing adjustments.

  2. Class-based Styling:

    • The green and red classes already contain the desired background colors (light green and light red). Now, these buttons will inherit the defined styles from the CSS, keeping the component cleaner.

With these changes, your action buttons will use the updated styles, including the lighter shades and proper spacing.

To update only the table under the "Pre-orders" tab with the new action buttons and status styling, while keeping the "Order Requests" table using the previous "completed" and "pending" statuses and a "complete" button for pending orders, you'll need to conditionally render the appropriate content based on the tab selected.

Here’s how you can update your ProductRequestsPage component to reflect this:

Updated Code for ProductRequestsPage Component:

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      date: '2025-01-15',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/notebook.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50, // New field to show current inventory
      status: 'pending', // Status for order requests
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      date: '2025-01-14',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/pencil.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'completed', // Status for order requests
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
      currentInventory: 20,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');
  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('pre-orders'); // Track which tab is active

  const handleActionClick = (id: number, action: string) => {
    setRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.filter((request) => request.id !== id)
    );
  };

  const filteredRequests = requests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      {/* Title */}
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      {/* Search and Tabs Container */}
      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        {/* Tabs */}
        <div className="tabs">
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('pre-orders')}
          >
            Pre-orders
          </button>
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'order-requests' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('order-requests')}
          >
            Order Requests
          </button>
        </div>

        {/* Search Filter */}
        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Table */}
      {activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User Email</th>
              <th>User Name</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Current Inventory</th> {/* New column */}
              <th>Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>{request.email}</td>
                <td>{request.name}</td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>{request.currentInventory}</td> {/* Show current inventory */}
                <td>
                  <button
                    className="action-button green"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'backInStock')}
                  >
                    Back in stock
                  </button>
                  <button
                    className="action-button red"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'unavailable')}
                  >
                    Unavailable
                  </button>
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      ) : (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User Email</th>
              <th>User Name</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Status</th>
              <th>Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>{request.email}</td>
                <td>{request.name}</td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>
                  <span
                    className={`status-label ${
                      request.status === 'completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                    }`}
                  >
                    {request.status.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + request.status.slice(1)}
                  </span>
                </td>
                <td>
                  {request.status === 'pending' && (
                    <button
                      className="complete-button"
                      onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'complete')}
                    >
                      Complete
                    </button>
                  )}
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

Key Updates:

  1. Tab Switch:

    • I added a state variable activeTab to track which tab (Pre-orders or Order Requests) is currently active.
    • The tab buttons now toggle the activeTab state to switch between "Pre-orders" and "Order Requests."

  2. Conditional Rendering of Tables:

    • For the "Pre-orders" tab, the table includes the new action buttons with the green and red classes.
    • For the "Order Requests" tab, the table shows the completed and pending status labels, and only displays the "Complete" button for pending orders.

  3. CSS Class Updates:

    • Added the active class to highlight the active tab.

This ensures that the "Pre-orders" and "Order Requests" tables are rendered differently, as per your requirements.

ChatGPT said:

To modify the "Complete" button behavior so that it changes the status from "pending" to "completed" without deleting the row, you can update the handleActionClick function to update the status of the request rather than removing it.

Here’s how you can adjust the code:

Updated Code:

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      date: '2025-01-15',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/notebook.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50,
      status: 'pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      date: '2025-01-14',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/pencil.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
      currentInventory: 20,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');
  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('pre-orders');

  const handleActionClick = (id: number) => {
    setRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) =>
        request.id === id && request.status === 'pending'
          ? { ...request, status: 'completed' } // Change status to completed
          : request
      )
    );
  };

  const filteredRequests = requests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        <div className="tabs">
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('pre-orders')}
          >
            Pre-orders
          </button>
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'order-requests' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('order-requests')}
          >
            Order Requests
          </button>
        </div>

        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User Email</th>
              <th>User Name</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Current Inventory</th>
              <th>Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>{request.email}</td>
                <td>{request.name}</td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>{request.currentInventory}</td>
                <td>
                  <button
                    className="action-button green"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id)}
                  >
                    Back in stock
                  </button>
                  <button
                    className="action-button red"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id)}
                  >
                    Unavailable
                  </button>
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      ) : (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User Email</th>
              <th>User Name</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Status</th>
              <th>Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>{request.email}</td>
                <td>{request.name}</td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>
                  <span
                    className={`status-label ${
                      request.status === 'completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                    }`}
                  >
                    {request.status.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + request.status.slice(1)}
                  </span>
                </td>
                <td>
                  {request.status === 'pending' && (
                    <button
                      className="complete-button"
                      onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id)}
                    >
                      Complete
                    </button>
                  )}
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

Changes Made:

  1. Action Button (Complete):

    • Now, when the "Complete" button is clicked, the status of the request changes from "pending" to "completed".
    • This is achieved by updating the handleActionClick function to check if the status is "pending" and change it to "completed".

  2. Row Update (No Deletion):

    • Instead of deleting the row, the row now remains, but its status is updated, and the table automatically reflects this change.
    • The row will have a "completed" status tag after clicking the "Complete" button.

With this update, the "Complete" button will no longer remove the row but will update the status from "pending" to "completed."

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      date: '2025-01-15',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/notebook.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50,
      status: 'pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      date: '2025-01-14',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/pencil.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
      currentInventory: 20,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');
  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('pre-orders');

  const handleActionClick = (id: number, action: string) => {
    setRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) => {
        if (request.id === id) {
          if (action === 'complete') {
            return { ...request, status: 'completed' }; // Change status to completed
          } else if (action === 'backInStock' || action === 'unavailable') {
            // Remove the row if the action is backInStock or unavailable
            return null;
          }
        }
        return request;
      }).filter((request) => request !== null) // Filter out any null values (deleted rows)
    );
  };

  const filteredRequests = requests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        <div className="tabs">
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('pre-orders')}
          >
            Pre-orders
          </button>
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'order-requests' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('order-requests')}
          >
            Order Requests
          </button>
        </div>

        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User Email</th>
              <th>User Name</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Current Inventory</th>
              <th className="action-header">Action</th> {/* Centered Action header */}
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>{request.email}</td>
                <td>{request.name}</td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>{request.currentInventory}</td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  <button
                    className="action-button green"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'backInStock')}
                  >
                    Back in stock
                  </button>
                  <button
                    className="action-button red"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'unavailable')}
                  >
                    Unavailable
                  </button>
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      ) : (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User Email</th>
              <th>User Name</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Status</th>
              <th className="action-header">Action</th> {/* Centered Action header */}
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>{request.email}</td>
                <td>{request.name}</td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>
                  <span
                    className={`status-label ${
                      request.status === 'completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                    }`}
                  >
                    {request.status.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + request.status.slice(1)}
                  </span>
                </td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  {request.status === 'pending' && (
                    <button
                      className="complete-button"
                      onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'complete')}
                    >
                      Complete
                    </button>
                  )}
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

ChatGPT said:

To ensure that the Pre-orders table and Order Requests table display different mock items, you can create separate mock data for each table and manage them in the component state.

1. Separate Mock Data for Pre-orders and Order Requests

You can define separate state variables for the pre-orders and order requests. For example, in the ProductRequestsPage component:

javascript
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [preOrders, setPreOrders] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'Alice Green',
      item: 'Coffee Mug',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-20',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/coffeemug.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50,
      status: 'pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Bob White',
      item: 'T-Shirt',
      quantity: 2,
      date: '2025-01-18',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/tshirt.jpg',
      currentInventory: 15,
      status: 'completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Charlie Black',
      item: 'Backpack',
      quantity: 4,
      date: '2025-01-19',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/backpack.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [orderRequests, setOrderRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      name: 'John Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      date: '2025-01-15',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/notebook.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50,
      status: 'pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      name: 'Jane Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      date: '2025-01-14',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/pencil.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      name: 'Sam Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
      currentInventory: 20,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');
  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('pre-orders');

  const handleActionClick = (id: number, action: string) => {
    setPreOrders((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) => {
        if (request.id === id) {
          if (action === 'complete') {
            return { ...request, status: 'completed' }; // Change status to completed
          } else if (action === 'backInStock' || action === 'unavailable') {
            // Remove the row if the action is backInStock or unavailable
            return null;
          }
        }
        return request;
      }).filter((request) => request !== null) // Filter out any null values (deleted rows)
    );

    setOrderRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) => {
        if (request.id === id) {
          if (action === 'complete') {
            return { ...request, status: 'completed' };
          } else if (action === 'backInStock' || action === 'unavailable') {
            return null;
          }
        }
        return request;
      }).filter((request) => request !== null)
    );
  };

  const filteredPreOrders = preOrders.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  const filteredOrderRequests = orderRequests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        <div className="tabs">
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('pre-orders')}
          >
            Pre-orders
          </button>
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'order-requests' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('order-requests')}
          >
            Order Requests
          </button>
        </div>

        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User Email</th>
              <th>User Name</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Current Inventory</th>
              <th className="action-header">Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredPreOrders.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>{request.email}</td>
                <td>{request.name}</td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>{request.currentInventory}</td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  <button
                    className="action-button green"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'backInStock')}
                  >
                    Back in stock
                  </button>
                  <button
                    className="action-button red"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'unavailable')}
                  >
                    Unavailable
                  </button>
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      ) : (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User Email</th>
              <th>User Name</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Status</th>
              <th className="action-header">Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredOrderRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>{request.email}</td>
                <td>{request.name}</td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>
                  <span
                    className={`status-label ${
                      request.status === 'completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                    }`}
                  >
                    {request.status.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + request.status.slice(1)}
                  </span>
                </td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  {request.status === 'pending' && (
                    <button
                      className="complete-button"
                      onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'complete')}
                    >
                      Complete
                    </button>
                  )}
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

Key Changes:

  • Separate preOrders and orderRequests state variables: Each table now has its own distinct set of mock items.
  • Updated mock items for both pre-orders and order requests: The data for pre-orders is different from the order requests, so each table will show its own specific data.
  • Filtered by activeTab: Based on whether the active tab is "Pre-orders" or "Order Requests," it displays the respective data.

Now, when you toggle between the tabs, the Pre-orders table and Order Requests table will display their own specific items.

The error is occurring because the component uses useState, which is a React hook that can only be used in client-side components. Since Next.js (version 15.1.4) enforces this distinction, you need to explicitly mark the component as a client-side component by adding the "use client" directive at the top of your file.

You can fix this error by ensuring the following line is added at the very top of your page.tsx file:

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [requests, setRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',

      status: 'completed',

      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
      currentInventory: 20,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');

      prevRequests
        .map((request) => {
          if (request.id === id) {
            if (action === 'complete') {
              return { ...request, status: 'completed' }; // Change status to completed
            } else if (action === 'backInStock' || action === 'unavailable') {
              // Remove the row if the action is backInStock or unavailable
              return null;
            }
          }
          return request;
        })
        .filter((request) => request !== null) // Filter out any null values (deleted rows)
    );
  };

  const filteredRequests = requests.filter((request) =>
    request.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        <div className="tabs">
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('pre-orders')}
          >
            Pre-orders
          </button>
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'order-requests' ? 'active' : ''}`}

          >
            Order Requests
          </button>
        </div>

          <input
            type="text"

            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? (

          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User Email</th>
              <th>User Name</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Current Inventory</th>
              <th className="action-header">Action</th> {/* Centered Action header */}
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>{request.email}</td>
                <td>{request.name}</td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>{request.currentInventory}</td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  <button
                    className="action-button green"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'backInStock')}
                  >
                    Back in stock
                  </button>
                  <button
                    className="action-button red"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'unavailable')}
                  >
                    Unavailable
                  </button>
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      ) : (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>

                  </span>
                </td>
                <td className="action-cell">

ChatGPT said:

To combine the user's first name and last name on the first line and show the email on the second line in the "User" column, you can modify the table structure and adjust the rendering of the user data. Here's an updated version of your component with the requested changes:

tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [preOrders, setPreOrders] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      firstName: 'Alice',
      lastName: 'Green',
      item: 'Coffee Mug',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-20',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/coffeemug.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50,
      status: 'pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      firstName: 'Bob',
      lastName: 'White',
      item: 'T-Shirt',
      quantity: 2,
      date: '2025-01-18',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/tshirt.jpg',
      currentInventory: 15,
      status: 'completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      firstName: 'Charlie',
      lastName: 'Black',
      item: 'Backpack',
      quantity: 4,
      date: '2025-01-19',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/backpack.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [orderRequests, setOrderRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      firstName: 'John',
      lastName: 'Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      date: '2025-01-15',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/notebook.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50,
      status: 'pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      firstName: 'Jane',
      lastName: 'Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      date: '2025-01-14',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/pencil.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      firstName: 'Sam',
      lastName: 'Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
      currentInventory: 20,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');
  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('pre-orders');

  const handleActionClick = (id: number, action: string) => {
    setPreOrders((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) => {
        if (request.id === id) {
          if (action === 'complete') {
            return { ...request, status: 'completed' };
          } else if (action === 'backInStock' || action === 'unavailable') {
            return null;
          }
        }
        return request;
      }).filter((request) => request !== null)
    );

    setOrderRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) => {
        if (request.id === id) {
          if (action === 'complete') {
            return { ...request, status: 'completed' };
          } else if (action === 'backInStock' || action === 'unavailable') {
            return null;
          }
        }
        return request;
      }).filter((request) => request !== null)
    );
  };

  const filteredPreOrders = preOrders.filter((request) =>
    request.firstName.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  const filteredOrderRequests = orderRequests.filter((request) =>
    request.firstName.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
    request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        <div className="tabs">
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('pre-orders')}
          >
            Pre-orders
          </button>
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'order-requests' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('order-requests')}
          >
            Order Requests
          </button>
        </div>

        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
        </div>
      </div>

      {activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Current Inventory</th>
              <th className="action-header">Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredPreOrders.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>
                  <div>{`${request.firstName} ${request.lastName}`}</div>
                  <div>{request.email}</div>
                </td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>{request.currentInventory}</td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  <button
                    className="action-button green"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'backInStock')}
                  >
                    Back in stock
                  </button>
                  <button
                    className="action-button red"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'unavailable')}
                  >
                    Unavailable
                  </button>
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      ) : (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User</th>
              <th>Item Name</th>
              <th>Item Image</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Status</th>
              <th className="action-header">Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredOrderRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>
                  <div>{`${request.firstName} ${request.lastName}`}</div>
                  <div>{request.email}</div>
                </td>
                <td>{request.item}</td>
                <td>
                  <img
                    src={request.imageUrl}
                    alt={request.item}
                    style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                  />
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>
                  <span
                    className={`status-label ${
                      request.status === 'completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                    }`}
                  >
                    {request.status.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + request.status.slice(1)}
                  </span>
                </td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  {request.status === 'pending' && (
                    <button
                      className="complete-button"
                      onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'complete')}
                    >
                      Complete
                    </button>
                  )}
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

Key Changes:

  1. I replaced name with firstName and lastName in both the preOrders and orderRequests arrays.
  2. In the table, I modified the User Name column to combine the firstName and lastName on the first line and show the email on the second line.
  3. Adjusted the column header to "User" instead of "User Email" and "User Name".

import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [preOrders, setPreOrders] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,

      firstName: 'Alice',

      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  ]);

          }

      }).filter((request) => request !== null)
    );

      prevRequests.map((request) => {
        if (request.id === id) {
          if (action === 'complete') {
            return { ...request, status: 'completed' };
          } else if (action === 'backInStock' || action === 'unavailable') {
            return null;
          }
        }
        return request;
      }).filter((request) => request !== null)
    );
  };

          </button>
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'order-requests' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('order-requests')}
          >
            Order Requests
          </button>
        </div>

        <div className="search-container">

            type="text"

                  <div>{request.email}</div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div>
                    <img
                      src={request.imageUrl}
                      alt={request.item}
                      style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                    />
                    <div>{request.item}</div>
                  </div>
                </td>

                  <button
                    className="action-button red"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'unavailable')}

                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>
                  <div>{`${request.firstName} ${request.lastName}`}</div>
                  <div>{request.email}</div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div>
                    <img
                      src={request.imageUrl}
                      alt={request.item}
                      style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                    />
                    <div>{request.item}</div>
                  </div>
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>
                  <span
                    className={`status-label ${
                      request.status === 'completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                    }`}
                  >
                    {request.status.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + request.status.slice(1)}
                  </span>
                </td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  {request.status === 'pending' && (
                    <button
                      className="complete-button"
                      onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'complete')}
                    >
                      Complete
                    </button>
                  )}
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;

In this update:

  • The Item column now contains both the image and item name.
  • The image is displayed on the first line, and the item name appears on the second line, inside the same cell.

To vertically center the "Complete" button within each row, you can make adjustments to the styling of the .action-cell class and ensure that the table row (<tr>) has a consistent height or padding.

Here’s the updated CSS and the relevant changes:

Updated CSS

css
/* Action Buttons for Product Requests Page */
.action-cell {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column; /* Stack the buttons vertically */
  justify-content: center; /* Center the buttons vertically */
  align-items: center; /* Align buttons horizontally */
  gap: 10px; /* Space between the stacked buttons */
  height: 100%; /* Ensure the cell height stretches to fill the row */
}

.complete-button {
  padding: 5px 10px;
  font-size: 14px;
  color: white;
  background-color: #007bff;
  border: none;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  border-radius: 5px;
  cursor: pointer;
  height: 40px; /* Ensure the button has consistent height */
}

.complete-button:hover {
  background-color: #0056b3;
}

Explanation of Changes:

  1. .action-cell Adjustments:

    • height: 100%: This ensures that the cell takes up the full available height of the row, which allows the vertical centering to work effectively.
    • justify-content: center: Ensures that the content (the "Complete" button) is centered vertically.
    • align-items: center: Centers the button horizontally.

  2. .complete-button Adjustments:

    • height: 40px: Ensures that the button maintains a consistent height, which helps with vertical alignment inside the table cell.

Final Considerations:

Ensure that the <td> cells containing action buttons don't have conflicting padding or margins that might impact the button's vertical centering. You can tweak the row's padding or height if necessary, depending on your layout requirements.

ChatGPT said:

To implement a filter date "to" date function on the right side of the search button, you need to add two date input fields (one for the "from" date and one for the "to" date), and then filter the displayed requests based on the selected date range.

Here's the updated code for your React component and CSS to include this functionality.

React Component:

jsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import './tags.css';

const ProductRequestsPage = () => {
  const [preOrders, setPreOrders] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      firstName: 'Alice',
      lastName: 'Green',
      item: 'Coffee Mug',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-20',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/coffeemug.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50,
      status: 'pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      firstName: 'Bob',
      lastName: 'White',
      item: 'T-Shirt',
      quantity: 2,
      date: '2025-01-18',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/tshirt.jpg',
      currentInventory: 15,
      status: 'completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      firstName: 'Charlie',
      lastName: 'Black',
      item: 'Backpack',
      quantity: 4,
      date: '2025-01-19',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/backpack.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [orderRequests, setOrderRequests] = useState([
    {
      id: 1,
      email: 'user1@example.com',
      firstName: 'John',
      lastName: 'Doe',
      item: 'Notebook',
      quantity: 5,
      date: '2025-01-15',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/notebook.jpg',
      currentInventory: 50,
      status: 'pending',
    },
    {
      id: 2,
      email: 'user2@example.com',
      firstName: 'Jane',
      lastName: 'Smith',
      item: 'Pencil',
      quantity: 10,
      date: '2025-01-14',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/pencil.jpg',
      currentInventory: 30,
      status: 'completed',
    },
    {
      id: 3,
      email: 'user3@example.com',
      firstName: 'Sam',
      lastName: 'Lee',
      item: 'Eraser',
      quantity: 3,
      date: '2025-01-16',
      imageUrl: 'https://example.com/images/eraser.jpg',
      currentInventory: 20,
      status: 'pending',
    },
  ]);

  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = useState('');
  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('pre-orders');
  const [fromDate, setFromDate] = useState('');
  const [toDate, setToDate] = useState('');

  const handleActionClick = (id, action) => {
    setPreOrders((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) => {
        if (request.id === id) {
          if (action === 'complete') {
            return { ...request, status: 'completed' };
          } else if (action === 'backInStock' || action === 'unavailable') {
            return null;
          }
        }
        return request;
      }).filter((request) => request !== null)
    );

    setOrderRequests((prevRequests) =>
      prevRequests.map((request) => {
        if (request.id === id) {
          if (action === 'complete') {
            return { ...request, status: 'completed' };
          } else if (action === 'backInStock' || action === 'unavailable') {
            return null;
          }
        }
        return request;
      }).filter((request) => request !== null)
    );
  };

  const filteredPreOrders = preOrders.filter((request) =>
    (request.firstName.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
      request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())) &&
    (!fromDate || new Date(request.date) >= new Date(fromDate)) &&
    (!toDate || new Date(request.date) <= new Date(toDate))
  );

  const filteredOrderRequests = orderRequests.filter((request) =>
    (request.firstName.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) ||
      request.item.toLowerCase().includes(searchTerm.toLowerCase())) &&
    (!fromDate || new Date(request.date) >= new Date(fromDate)) &&
    (!toDate || new Date(request.date) <= new Date(toDate))
  );

  return (
    <div className="product-requests-container">
      <h1 className="page-title">Product Requests</h1>

      <div className="search-tabs-container">
        <div className="tabs">
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('pre-orders')}
          >
            Pre-orders
          </button>
          <button
            className={`tab ${activeTab === 'order-requests' ? 'active' : ''}`}
            onClick={() => setActiveTab('order-requests')}
          >
            Order Requests
          </button>
        </div>

        <div className="search-container">
          <input
            type="text"
            placeholder="Search by User Name or Item Name"
            value={searchTerm}
            onChange={(e) => setSearchTerm(e.target.value)}
            className="search-input"
          />
          <div className="date-filters">
            <input
              type="date"
              value={fromDate}
              onChange={(e) => setFromDate(e.target.value)}
              className="date-input"
            />
            <span>to</span>
            <input
              type="date"
              value={toDate}
              onChange={(e) => setToDate(e.target.value)}
              className="date-input"
            />
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      {activeTab === 'pre-orders' ? (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User</th>
              <th>Item</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Current Inventory</th>
              <th className="action-header">Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredPreOrders.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>
                  <div>{`${request.firstName} ${request.lastName}`}</div>
                  <div>{request.email}</div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div>
                    <img
                      src={request.imageUrl}
                      alt={request.item}
                      style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                    />
                    <div>{request.item}</div>
                  </div>
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>{request.currentInventory}</td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  <button
                    className="action-button green"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'backInStock')}
                  >
                    Back in stock
                  </button>
                  <button
                    className="action-button red"
                    onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'unavailable')}
                  >
                    Unavailable
                  </button>
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      ) : (
        <table className="requests-table">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th>Date</th>
              <th>User</th>
              <th>Item</th>
              <th>Quantity Ordered</th>
              <th>Status</th>
              <th className="action-header">Action</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
            {filteredOrderRequests.map((request) => (
              <tr key={request.id}>
                <td>{request.date}</td>
                <td>
                  <div>{`${request.firstName} ${request.lastName}`}</div>
                  <div>{request.email}</div>
                </td>
                <td>
                  <div>
                    <img
                      src={request.imageUrl}
                      alt={request.item}
                      style={{ width: '50px', height: '50px', objectFit: 'cover' }}
                    />
                    <div>{request.item}</div>
                  </div>
                </td>
                <td>{request.quantity}</td>
                <td>
                  <span
                    className={`status-label ${
                      request.status === 'completed' ? 'completed' : 'pending'
                    }`}
                  >
                    {request.status.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + request.status.slice(1)}
                  </span>
                </td>
                <td className="action-cell">
                  {request.status === 'pending' && (
                    <button
                      className="complete-button"
                      onClick={() => handleActionClick(request.id, 'complete')}
                    >
                      Complete
                    </button>
                  )}
                </td>
              </tr>
            ))}
          </tbody>
        </table>
      )}
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProductRequestsPage;
